alert.note: Alert for Mobile (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 30 at 8:06AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Alabama, including the following county, Mobile. portions of southeast Mississippi, including the following county, George. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 803 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated showers and thunderstorms producing very heavy rainfall over the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain with locally higher amounts may quickly fall in a short period of time, which could lead to flooding of urban and low lying areas in addition to creeks and streams. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tillmans Corner, Theodore, Grand Bay, Bayou La Batre, Tanner Williams, Semmes, Mobile Regional Airport, Wilmer, Coden, Seven Hills, Dawes, Dees, Meadow Lake, Orchard, Wheelerville, West Hill, Saint Elmo, Irvington, Lott and Millertown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
